headline.main: LOCAL MILITARY MOVEMENTS.; ARRIVAL OF A REGIMENT FROM ONEIDA COUNTY A STAND OF COLORS TO BE PRESENTED. COL. VON GILSA'S REGIMENT. SECOND REGIMENT SCOTT LIFE GUARD OFF. WILSON ZOUAVES. THE PARK EARRACKS. COMMISSION OF MAJOR-GEN. DIX. THE BATTERY ENCAMPMENT. RELIGIOUS EFFORTS AMONG THE SOLDIERS. THE ANDERSON ZOUAVES. COL. LANSING'S SEVENTEENTH VOLUNTEER REGIMENT. COL. MATTHEWSON'S FIRST CALIFORNIA REGIMENT. THE STATEN ISLAND FERRIES. BENEFIT OF THE BRITISH VOLUNTEERS. NEW MILITARY ORGANIZATION. RECRUITS FOR SICKLES' BRIGADE. THE BROOKLYN VOLUNTEERS. RELIEF FOR THE VOLUNTEERS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Fourteenth Regiment, New York State Volunteers, Col. McQUADE, will arrive in this City at 10 o'clock tomorrow morning. A very beautiful regimental standard for this regiment was furnished by TIFFANY Co., on Saturday, to the order of gentlemen of our City.

docs.snippet: The steamship Jura, from Liverpool, at 4 P.M. 6th, via Londonderry 7th, passed this point at 9 o'clock for Quebec.

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; THE JURA OFF FATHER POINT. DEATH OF COUNT CAVOUR. The American Question in England. Another Declaration in Regard to Privateers. Cotton and Provisions Steady Bread stuffs Dull. FRANCE. ITALY. AUSTRIA.

docs.snippet: Our volunteer troops at the various military camps and forts throughout the country have thus far enjoyed a remarkable degree of general health, and an almost entire immunity from the various epidemics which so frequently follow in the wake of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Our volunteer troops at the various military camps and forts throughout the country have thus far enjoyed a remarkable degree of general health, and an almost entire immunity from the various epidemics which so frequently follow in the wake of advancing armies.

headline.main: THE GREAT INSURRECTION.; Further Particulars of the Evacuation of Harper's Ferry. Ten Thousand of Gen. Patterson's Command at Hagerstown.The Obstructions on the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad Removed. TRAINS RUNNING TO HARPER'S FERRY. Concentration of the Rebels atManassas Junction. Another Expedition Fitting Out at Fortress Monroe. ITS DESTINATION UNKNOWN. Fifteen Thousand Additional Troops Called for by Gen. Butler. THE TREASON IN MISSOURI. PAYING THE DAMAGES. THE ZOUAVE UNIFORMS. TROOPS IN VIRGINIA. A BALLOON SEEN. INSPECTION AT ALEXANDRIA. POLICE OF ALEXANDRIA. DISPATCH TO THE ASSOCIATED PRESS.

docs.snippet: It is with an oppressed spirit I sit down to write this letter, having but two hours since returned from watching with a friend, suffering from yellow fever, and who, I fear, will never leave his room a living man.

headline.main: From Our Own Correspondent.; THE LATE DUEL. ST. DOMINGO. MEXICO.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is with an oppressed spirit I sit down to write this letter, having but two hours since returned from watching with a friend, suffering from yellow fever, and who, I fear, will never leave his room a living man.

docs.snippet: The ship Nightingale, J.J. GUTHRIE, United States Navy, Commanding, arrived at this port, yesterday morning, from Monrovia, West Coast of Africa, which port she left May 13, and anchored at Quarantine.

headline.main: CAPTURE OF A SLAVER.; The Ship Nightingale Seized by the United Sloop-of-War Saratoga, with Nine Hundred and Fifty Negroes on Board.

docs.lead_paragraph: The ship Nightingale, J.J. GUTHRIE, United States Navy, Commanding, arrived at this port, yesterday morning, from Monrovia, West Coast of Africa, which port she left May 13, and anchored at Quarantine.
